definitions.definition: Risky, dangerous, with the nature of a hazard.
Of or involving chance.
Something that silences.
Sorbus aucuparia, the European rowan.
Any of various small deciduous trees or shrubs of genus Sorbus, belonging to the rose family, with pinnate leaves, corymbs of white flowers, and usually with orange-red berries.
A second crop of hay; aftermath.
A stubble field left unploughed until late in the autumn, so that it can be cropped by cattle.
Great dishonor, shame, or humiliation.
A Vietnamese sandwich, typically served on a baguette, and somewhat resembling a submarine sandwich.
Capable of being realized or achieved.
An intermittent fever or disease.
Stopping and starting, occuring, or presenting at intervals; coming after a particular time span.
definitions.example: Intermittent bugs are most difficult to reproduce.

definitions.definition: (specifically, of a body of water) Existing only for certain seasons; that is, being dry for part of the year.
definitions.example: The area has many intermittent lakes and streams.

definitions.definition: A first name, a name chosen for a child, usually by the child's parents; a forename.
Someone living in the same house.
The reestablishment of cordial relations, particularly between two countries; a reconciliation.
definitions.example: It was the Nixon administration that saw the rapprochement between the United States and China.

definitions.definition: A small toy dog, kept as household pet, whose light weight and companionable temperament make it both suited and disposed to spend time resting in the comfort of its master's lap; a dog bred to behave in this manner.
(by extension) A person who behaves in a servile manner, such as a sycophantic employee or a fawning lover.
A soft, non-matured, Indian cheese.
definitions.example: The spinach was mixed with paneer to make a satisfying meal.

definitions.definition: A building of this kind.
Of a building: built with rooms on levels separated by stairs of less than a full storey.
Capable of being commuted.
An uncultivated ridge formed in the open field system, caused by the action of ploughing.
The wall of earth at the edge of an excavation.
Beam, crossbeam; squared timber; a tie beam of a house, stretching from wall to wall, especially when laid so as to form a loft, "the balks".
A hindrance or disappointment; a check.
A sudden and obstinate stop; a failure.
An omission.
A deceptive motion; a feint.
The area of the table lying behind the line from which the cue ball is initially shot, and from which a ball in hand must be played.
The area of the table lying behind the baulk line.
The rope by which fishing nets are fastened together.
To pass over or by.
To omit, miss or overlook by chance.
To miss intentionally; to avoid.
To stop, check, block.
To stop short and refuse to go on.
definitions.example: The horse balked.

definitions.definition: To refuse suddenly.
To disappoint; to frustrate.
definitions.example: to balk expectation

definitions.definition: To engage in contradiction; to be in opposition.
To leave or make balks in.
To leave heaped up; to heap up in piles.
Associated with or participating in an activity, especially one of a questionable nature.

A literary text written in the manner of prose—without the fixed lines, rhyme, and meter often characteristic of poetry—but nonetheless clearly possessing some of the distinctive attributes of poetry, such as lyrical language, evocation of feeling, vivid imagery, metaphor, and linguistic devices like assonance or alliteration.
The act of waiving, or not insisting on, some right, claim, or privilege.
A legal document removing some requirement, such as waiving a right (giving it up) or a waiver of liability (agreeing to hold someone blameless).
definitions.example: I had to sign a waiver when I went skydiving, agreeing not to sue even if something went wrong.

definitions.definition: Something that releases a person from a requirement.
definitions.example: I needed a waiver from the department head to take the course because I didn't technically have the prerequisite courses.

definitions.definition: The process of waiving or outlawing a person.
To waive (to relinquish, to forego).
To clean the utensils, dishes etc. used in preparing and eating a meal.
definitions.example: I'm not washing up all these dishes.

definitions.definition: To wash one's hands and/or face, often around mealtimes.
definitions.example: Dinner is almost ready, so go and wash up.

definitions.definition: (of water) To carry (an object) to land.
definitions.example: The tide washes up a lot of driftwood.

definitions.definition: To be carried by water to land.
definitions.example: Some dangerous chemicals washed up on the beach.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To arrive in a place; to end up somewhere.
Finished; having no future in a particular role; no longer capable, effective or needed.
definitions.example: Pavarotti's washed up as a singer, in my view.

definitions.definition: A nervous wriggling or twitching motion.
A person who fidgets, especially habitually.
A toy intended to be fidgeted with.
To wiggle or twitch; to move around nervously or idly.
To cause to fidget; to make uneasy.
An aircraft wing having a swept-back shape in the form of an isosceles triangle; used mostly on supersonic aircraft
An electromagnetic wave having a wavelength between approximately 10 and 100 meters, corresponding to frequencies between 3 and 30 MHz.
definitions.example: Shortwaves are longer than microwaves.

definitions.definition: (usually in plural) Any frequency in this range, especially when used in broadcasting.
definitions.example: Many stations broadcast on shortwaves.

definitions.definition: A vote against something that reduces a cumulative tally of popularity.
To vote against, reducing a cumulative tally of popularity.
A station built for the production of electric power; a power station.
The portion of a vehicle devoted to providing energy for motion; the engine or motor.
Badly adjusted to the demands and stresses of daily living; unable to cope.
To hit or strike violently and repeatedly.
definitions.example: The firemen battered down the door.

definitions.definition: To coat with batter (the food ingredient).
definitions.example: I prefer it when they batter the cod with breadcrumbs.

definitions.definition: To defeat soundly; to thrash.
definitions.example: Leeds United battered Charlton 7-0.

definitions.definition: (usually in the passive) To intoxicate.
definitions.example: I was battered last night on our pub crawl.

definitions.definition: To flatten (metal) by hammering, so as to compress it inwardly and spread it outwardly.
A beaten mixture of flour and liquid (usually egg and milk), used for baking (e.g. pancakes, cake, or Yorkshire pudding) or to coat food (e.g. fish) prior to frying
definitions.example: To the dismay of his mother, the boy put his finger into the cake batter.

definitions.definition: A binge, a heavy drinking session.
definitions.example: When he went on a batter, he became very violent.

definitions.definition: A paste of clay or loam.
A bruise on the face of a plate or of type in the form.
An incline on the outer face of a built wall.
To slope (of walls, buildings etc.).
The player attempting to hit the ball with a bat.
definitions.example: The first batter hit the ball into the corner for a double.

definitions.definition: The player attempting to hit the ball with a bat; a batsman.
An entrance, entry point, or means of entry.
definitions.example: The local library, a portal of knowledge.

definitions.definition: A website or page that acts as an entrance to other websites or pages on the Internet.
definitions.example: The new medical portal has dozens of topical categories containing links to hundreds of sites.

definitions.definition: A short vein that carries blood into the liver.
A magical or technological doorway leading to another location, period in time or dimension.
A lesser gate, where there are two of different dimensions.
Formerly, a small square corner in a room separated from the rest of an apartment by wainscoting, forming a short passage to another apartment.
A grandiose and often lavish entrance.
(bridge-building) The space, at one end, between opposite trusses when these are terminated by inclined braces.
A prayer book or breviary; a portass.
Of or relating to a porta, especially the porta of the liver.
definitions.example: the portal vein

definitions.definition: Happening many times in a similar way; containing repetition; repeating.
Someone who guards a premises at night.
A batsman who is sent in to bat higher than his usual position near the end of a day's play (when light is poor), in order to protect better batsmen.
The study of the history, language and culture of China; Chinese studies.
(Cold War) The study of the internal politics of the high members of the government of the People's Republic of China.

A Mexican snack food; a small tortilla (soft or hard shelled), with typically some type of meat, rice, beans, cheese, diced vegetables (usually tomatoes and lettuce, as served in the United States, and cilantro, onion, and avocado, as served in México) and salsa.
The vulva.
A yellow stain on a shirt armpit caused by sweat or deodorant.
To fold or cause to buckle in half, similar to the way a taco is folded.
The act of provoking, inciting or annoying someone into doing something
Something that provokes; a provocative act
The second step in OPQRST regarding the investigation of what makes the symptoms MOI or NOI improve or deteriorate.
definitions.example: When it's time to check for provocation ask the patient about what makes their chief complaint better or worse.

definitions.definition: A cocktail made from whiskey, sweet vermouth and bitters.
A bar chart representing the number of runs scored each over (supposed to resemble a skyline of skyscrapers).
(of goods) Not new; previously owned and used by another.
(of a dealer) Dealing in such merchandise.
Indirect; from a secondary source; not firsthand.
(of cigarette or cigar smoke) inhaled from the air near someone else smoking.
definitions.example: exposure to secondhand smoke from cigarette-smoking colleagues

definitions.definition: A pardon of a sin; the forgiveness of an offence, or relinquishment of a (legal) claim or a debt.
A lessening of amount due, as in either money or work, or intensity of a thing.
An act of remitting, returning, or sending back.
(spectroscopy) Reflection or scattering of light by a material; reemission.
A device placed on railway tracks causing a train to derail.
definitions.example: The derail was placed deliberately so that the train would fall into the river.

definitions.definition: An instance of diverting a conversation or debate from its original topic.
To cause to come off the tracks.
definitions.example: The train was destroyed when it was derailed by the penny.

definitions.definition: To come off the tracks.
To deviate from the previous course or direction.
definitions.example: The conversation derailed once James brought up politics.

definitions.definition: To cause to deviate from a set course or direction; derange.
definitions.example: The protesting students derailed the professor's lecture.

definitions.definition: (UK politics) Someone who supports the United Kingdom remaining within the European Union.
One who remains.
A part or parts remaining after some has/have been removed.
definitions.example: My son ate part of his cake and I ate the remainder.

definitions.definition: The amount left over after subtracting the divisor as many times as possible from the dividend without producing a negative result. If (n) (dividend) and d (divisor) are integers, then (n) can always be expressed in the form n = dq + r, where q (quotient) and r (remainder) are also integers and 0 ≤ r < d.
definitions.example: 11 divided by 2 is 5 remainder 1.

definitions.definition: The number left over after a simple subtraction
definitions.example: 10 minus 4 leaves a remainder of 6

definitions.definition: Excess stock items left unsold and subject to reduction in price.
definitions.example: I got a really good price on this shirt because it was a remainder.

definitions.definition: An estate in expectancy which only comes in its heir's possession after an estate created by the same instrument has been determined
A deep-bowled spoon with a long, usually curved, handle.
A container used in a foundry to transport and pour out molten metal.
The float of a mill wheel; a ladle board.
An instrument for drawing the charge of a cannon.
A ring, with a handle or handles fitted to it, for carrying shot.
To pour or serve something with a ladle.
definitions.example: One man ladled molten steel into the shot sleeve.

definitions.definition: In a self-satisfied manner.
definitions.example: He was smirking smugly at us.

definitions.definition: The hours of darkness between sunset and sunrise; the night.
A person who serves as an example, whose behavior is emulated by others
The part of a shore between high water and low water, especially the beach exposed at maximum ebb spring tides.
Using power or authority without proper consideration for the feelings or rights of others.
Attempting to achieve goals by cunning, scheming, and unscrupulous methods, especially in politics or in advancing one's career.
Related to the philosophical system of Niccolò Machiavelli.
The state of being bored.
An instance or period of being bored; A bored state.
Any of various insects of the order Phasmida that mimic sticks or twigs.
A taking down: the arrest of a suspect by a police officer.
A taking down: an act of bringing one's opponent to the ground by grabbing one or both legs and applying a rearward bending moment.
Enforced removal of material from a website, etc.
A person seeking employment.
An unemployed person who needs to prove he/she is looking for work in order to obtain government benefits.
Someone who lives on a pension, especially the retirement or old age pension.
(by extension) Someone who is at the age at which one typically receives a pension; an elderly person.
(Cambridge University) A student who is not dependent on any foundation for support, but pays all university charges; at Oxford called a commoner.
A plant, Pisum sativum, member of the legume (Fabaceae) family.
The edible seed of some of these plants.
A ball travelling at high velocity.
(Indiana) Any of the small numbered balls used in a pea shake game.
Any of several varieties of bean.
A peafowl
Wampum.
A point; the sharp end or top of anything that terminates in a point; as, the peak, or front, of a cap.
The highest value reached by some quantity in a time period.
definitions.example: The stock market reached a peak in September 1929.

definitions.definition: The top, or one of the tops, of a hill, mountain, or range, ending in a point.
definitions.example: They reached the peak after 8 hours of climbing.

definitions.definition: The whole hill or mountain, especially when isolated.
The upper aftermost corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
definitions.example: peak-brails

definitions.definition: The narrow part of a vessel's bow, or the hold within it.
The extremity of an anchor fluke; the bill.
A local maximum of a function, e.g. for sine waves, each point at which the value of y is at its maximum.
A group of two or more trained individuals, formed as a team that operates an aircraft.
definitions.example: The aircrew ran to the bomber.

definitions.definition: The appearance of an organism based on a multifactorial combination of genetic traits and environmental factors, especially used in pedigrees.
Any observable characteristic of an organism, such as its morphological, developmental, biochemical or physiological properties, or its behavior.
To evaluate or classify based on phenotype
A tropical fruit of the tree genus Garcinia.
The tree on which the fruit grows.
A slender stick used by skiers in both hands to improve speed and balance.
Cloudy diffused matter such as mist, steam or fumes suspended in the air.
The gaseous state of a substance that is normally a solid or liquid.
Something insubstantial, fleeting, or transitory; unreal fancy; vain imagination; idle talk; boasting.
Any medicinal agent designed for administration in the form of inhaled vapour.
(in the plural) Hypochondria; melancholy; the blues; hysteria, or other nervous disorder.
Wind; flatulence.
To become vapor; to be emitted or circulated as vapor.
To turn into vapor.
definitions.example: to vapor away a heated fluid

definitions.definition: To emit vapor or fumes.
To use insubstantial language; to boast or bluster.
To give (someone) the vapors; to depress, to bore.
A victory ceremony of less importance than a triumph.
(by extension) A (ceremony for the) recognition of some achievement.
(by extension) Prolonged enthusiastic applause.
To give (someone) an ovation (prolonged enthusiastic applause).
The act of laying eggs.
A spirit in Burmese mythology, whose cult is followed alongside Buddhism.
Not.
A logarithmic unit of information or entropy, based on natural logarithms.
Of a parent, not employed, and rather devoting more time to one's children.
Of rules or regulations, forbidding the populace to leave their domicile except under emergency or other special circumstances, especially for purposes of quarantine.
definitions.example: stay-at-home orders

definitions.definition: Of or relating to quarantine in the home.
definitions.example: stay-at-home boredom

definitions.definition: A sustained increase in the average temperature of the Earth, sufficient to cause climate change.
Very sincere and difficult emotional problems or stress
The state of things being similar or identical.
A point of resemblance; a similarity.
The state of being conforming, of complying with a set of rules, with a norm or standard.
The ideology of adhering to one standard or social uniformity.
One who conserves, preserves or protects something.
A person appointed by a court to manage the affairs of another; similar to a guardian but with some powers of a trustee.
An officer in charge of preserving the public peace, such as a justice or sheriff.
A judge delegated by the pope to defend certain privileged classes of persons from manifest or notorious injury or violence, without recourse to a judicial process.
A professional who works on the conservation and restoration of objects, particularly artistic objects.
(dog-breeding) A female dog or other canine, particularly a recent mother.
definitions.example: My bitch just had puppies; they're so cute!

definitions.definition: A promiscuous woman, slut, whore.
A despicable or disagreeable, aggressive person, usually a woman.
definitions.example: Ann gossiped about me and mocked my work; sometimes she can be a real bitch!

definitions.definition: A woman.
A man considered weak, effeminate, timid or pathetic in some way
A submissive person who does what others want; a man forced or coerced into a homoerotic relationship.
definitions.example: Dude, don't be such a bitch. Assert yourself.

definitions.definition: (of a man) A playful variation on dog (sense "man").
(used with a possessive pronoun) Friend.
definitions.example: How my bitches been doin'?

definitions.definition: A complaint, especially when the complaint is unjustified.
(usually only used in the singular) A difficult or confounding problem.
definitions.example: Level 5 was a real bitch, don’t you think?

definitions.definition: A queen (playing card), particularly the queen of spades in the card game of hearts.
Something unforgiving and unpleasant.
definitions.example: Karma's a bitch.

definitions.definition: Place; situation
To behave or act as a bitch.
To criticize spitefully, often for the sake of complaining rather than in order to have the problem corrected.
definitions.example: All you ever do is bitch about the food I cook for you!

definitions.definition: To spoil, to ruin.
A piece of timber laid horizontally, or nearly so, to which the planks of the floor, or the laths or furring strips of a ceiling, are nailed.
To fit or furnish with joists.
Lacking normative assumptions.
Ordinary, monotonous routine; that which is usual or mundane.
definitions.example: People come here to escape the day-to-day.

definitions.definition: Ordinary or mundane.
definitions.example: One has to deal with the day-to-day chores.

definitions.definition: Happening every day.
definitions.example: I would like to know about the day-to-day workings of the business.

definitions.definition: Subject to daily redetermination.
definitions.example: He has an ankle sprain and his status is day-to-day.

definitions.definition: On a daily basis.
definitions.example: The cost of gasoline is determined day-to-day.

definitions.definition: A squall line, multicell line, or part of a squall line.
A sudden storm, as found in a squall line.
A loud cry or wail.
To cry or wail loudly.

A person who makes money by passing the hat (soliciting donations) while entertaining the public (often by playing a musical instrument) on the streets or in other public area such as a park or market.
A grandchild of a grandparent's sibling.
A relative who has with the other person only two great-grandparents in common, but where the parents and grandparents are different.
An organism whose cell (or cells) are characterized by the absence of a nucleus or any other membrane-bound organelles.
In the two-empire system of biological taxonomy, an organism of the kingdom Prokaryotae (now superseded).
The breaking of a heart; great grief, anguish or distress.
That causes great grief, anguish or distress.
To make a bargain; to make a deal or contract for the exchange of property or services; to negotiate
definitions.example: They had to bargain for a few minutes to get a decent price for the rug.

definitions.definition: To transfer for a consideration; to barter; to trade
The act of one who bargains.
One who reaps.
A machine used to harvest crops.
(often with initial capital) Short for Grim Reaper.
A path for pedestrians.
A bag or case with one or two shoulder straps, especially used to carry books etc.
definitions.example: "Come, now, take yourselves off, like good boys and girls," he said; and the whole assemblage, dark and light, disappeared through a door into a large verandah, followed by Eva, who carried a large satchel, which she had been filling with apples, nuts, candy, ribbons, laces, and toys of every description, during her whole homeward journey.

definitions.definition: One who travels, especially on a journey to visit sites of religious significance.
A newcomer.
A silk screen formerly attached to the back of a woman's bonnet to protect the neck.
To journey; to wander; to ramble.
A circle of light; a halo.
A gray rain cloud.
A spicy tomato sauce, often including onions and hot peppers.
A style of urban music originally from New York heavily influenced by Cuban dance music, jazz and rock.
Any of several dances performed to salsa music.
To dance the salsa.
The outer skin of a banana, especially once removed from the rest of the banana, which may be slippery if stepped on.
A cause of difficulty, or potential embarrassment.
definitions.example: The subject is becoming a political banana skin.

definitions.definition: An expression which inveighs or rails against a person.
A severe or violent censure or reproach.
Something spoken or written, intended to cast shame, disgrace, censure, or reproach on another.
A harsh or reproachful accusation.
definitions.example: Politics can raise invective to a low art.

definitions.definition: Characterized by invection or railing.
definitions.example: Tom's speeches became diatribes — each more invective than the last.

definitions.definition: A moderate and proportionable mixture of elements or ingredients in a compound; the condition in which elements are mixed in their proper proportions.
Any state or condition as determined by the proportion of its ingredients or the manner in which they are mixed; consistence, composition; mixture.
A person's usual manner of thinking, behaving or reacting.
A tendency to become irritable or angry.
The altering of certain intervals from their correct values in order to improve the moving from key to key.
Individual differences in behavior that are biologically based and are relatively independent of learning, system of values and attitudes.
Motivated to achieve something due to one's own interest.
